intro: Senecio lindenii, commonly known as the Lindley's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Senecio lindenii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardiness.
